29 // Get array item type from an array type, e.g. int[] -> int
30 template <typename T>
31 using stripArray = typename std::remove_all_extents<T>::type;
32 
33 // Get a pointer array type from an array type, e.g. int[] -> int*
34 template <typename T>
35 using arrayToPointer = typename std::add_pointer_t<stripArray<T>>;
36 
37 
38 // Get the innermost type of a chain, e.g. std::shared_ptr<T> -> T, std::vector<T> -> T
39 template<typename T>
40 struct innermost_impl
41 {
42  using type = stripArray<T>;
43 };
44 
45 template<template<typename...> class E, typename Head, typename... Tail>
46 struct innermost_impl<E<Head, Tail...>>
47 {
48  using type = typename innermost_impl<stripArray<Head>>::type;
49 };
50 
51 template<typename T>
52 using innermost = typename innermost_impl<T>::type;
53 
54 
55 // Set up tag dispatching to detect if vector
56 template<typename T> struct is_vector : public std::false_type {};
57 template<typename T, typename A> // Allocator, which is almost always left to default
58 struct is_vector<std::vector<T, A>> : public std::true_type {};
59 
60 // Set up tag dispatching to detect if shared pointer
61 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
62 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
63 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T const>> : std::true_type {};
64 
65 
66 // Utility to test whether every predicate in a pack is true
67 // See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29603364/type-trait-to-check-that-all-types-in-a-parameter-pack-are-copy-constructible/29603857#29603857
68 // See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32267516/creating-variadic-accepting-only-reference-or-pointer
69 template<typename... Conds>
70 struct and_
71  : std::true_type
72 { };
73 
74 template<typename Cond, typename... Conds>
75 struct and_<Cond, Conds...>
76  : std::conditional<Cond::value, and_<Conds...>, std::false_type>::type
77 { };
78 
79 // Check whether or not a predicate is a value type
80 template <typename T>
81 using is_value_type =
82 std::integral_constant<bool,
83  !is_vector<T>::value &&
84  !std::is_pointer<T>::value &&
85  !std::is_array<T>::value &&
86  !is_shared_ptr<T>::value
87 >;
88 
89 // Check whether or not all predicate are value types
90 template <typename... Ts>
91 using are_value_types = and_<is_value_type<Ts>...>;
92 
93 // Get the pointer type member given a composite type
94 template <typename T>
95 using innermost_pointer_type = typename std::conditional_t<std::is_pointer<innermost<T>>::value,
96  innermost<T>, // Innermost type is a pointer, use directly
97  typename std::add_pointer_t<innermost<T>>>; // Innermost type is a value type, return pointer to it
98 
99 // Get reference to type if value, or plain old pointer if pointer
100 template <typename T>
101 using reference_type = typename std::conditional_t<std::is_pointer<T>::value,
102  T, // Innermost type is a pointer, use directly
103  typename std::add_lvalue_reference_t<T>>; // Innermost type is a value type, return reference to it
104 
105

125  template<typename U = T>
126  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, typename std::enable_if_t<std::is_array<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
127  ProtocolFieldInfo(field[0], std::size(field))
128  {
129  Object().logInfo("Array construction");
130  }
131 
133  template<typename U = T>
134  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, uint64 count,
135  typename std::enable_if_t<std::is_pointer<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
136  ProtocolFieldInfo(field[0], count)
137  {
138  Object().logInfo("Pointer array construction");
139  }
140 
142 
143  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
146 
148  template<typename U = T>
149  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, typename std::enable_if_t<is_vector<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
150  ProtocolFieldInfo(*field.data(), field.size()) // Call constructor using vector data and size
151  {
152  }
153 
155  template<typename U = T>
156  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, uint64 count, typename std::enable_if_t<is_vector<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
157  ProtocolFieldInfo(*field.data(), count) // Call constructor using vector data and count
158  {
159  }

168  template<typename U = T>
169  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, typename std::enable_if_t<is_shared_ptr<U>::value>* = nullptr):
170  ProtocolFieldInfo((decltype(*std::declval<U>()))*field)
171  {
172  }
173 
175 
176  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
179 
182  template<typename U = T> // SFINAE only works for deduced template argument, i.e. for function templates
183  ProtocolFieldInfo(U& field, uint64 count,
184  typename std::enable_if_t<is_value_type<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
185  m_fieldData(&field), // Store a pointer to the value
186  m_count(count)
187  {
188  }
189

195  m_fieldData(field), // Store a pointer to the value
196  m_count(count)
197  {
198  Q_UNUSED(dummyPtr)
199  }

207  //{

216  !std::is_same<U, ProtocolFieldInfo>::value>* = nullptr) :
217  m_fieldData(&field), // Store a pointer to the value
218  m_count(1)

283 template<typename T>
284 const size_t ProtocolFieldInfo<T>::s_typeSize = sizeof(decltype(*std::declval<innermost_pointer_type<T>>()));

289 template<typename T>
290 struct ProtocolField {
291  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
294 
295 
297 
298  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
301 
302  // Indirection was causing compile-time sadness when caching m_field for arrays fixed-length arrays
303  //template<typename U = T> // Indirection allows to pass fixed length arrays without exact length, e.g. int[8] as int[]
304  ProtocolField(T& field):
305  m_info(field),
306  m_field(field)
307  {
308  //static_assert(std::is_same<U, T>(), "Types must be absolutely identical");
309  }
310 
311  ProtocolField(ProtocolField& pField) :
312  m_info(pField.m_info),
313  m_field(pField.m_field)
314  {
315  }
316 
317  // Move constructor, untested
318  ProtocolField(ProtocolField&& pField) :
319  m_info(std::forward<ProtocolField<T>>(pField).m_info),
320  m_field(std::forward<ProtocolField<T>>(pField).m_field)
321  {
322  }
323 
324  //template<typename U = T> // Indirection allows to pass fixed length arrays without exact length, e.g. int[8] as int[]
325  ProtocolField(T& field, const long& count) :
326  m_info(field, count),
327  m_field(field)
328  {
329  }
330 
334  template<typename U = T>
335  ProtocolField(U field, const long& count,
336  typename std::enable_if_t<std::is_pointer<U>::value>* = nullptr) :
337  m_info(field, count, true), // Ambiguous call without third argument
338  m_field(field)
339  {
340  }
341 
342  ~ProtocolField() {
343  }
344 
346 
347  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
350 
353  // C++17, constexpr does a compile-time check for the condition
354  // if constexpr(std::is_same<T, std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<decltype(m_info.m_fieldData)>>>::value) {
355  inline bool write(const FileStream& stream) const
356  {
357  // TODO: Figure out a way to do this while still enabling recursive construction
358  // Write for a vector field
359  if constexpr (std::is_same<T, std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<innermost_pointer_type<T>>>>::value) {
360  // Field is a vector
361  return stream.write(m_field);
362  }
363  else {
364  // Field is not a vector
365  return stream.write(m_info.m_fieldData, m_info.m_count);
366  }
367  }
368 
370  // SFINAE solution, C++17 one is cleaner
371  //template<typename U = T>
372  //inline std::enable_if_t<!std::is_same<U, std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<innermost_pointer_type<U>>>>::value, bool>
373  // write(const FileStream& stream)
374  //{
375  // return stream.write(m_info.m_fieldData, m_info.m_count);
376  //}
377 
380  inline bool read(const FileStream& stream)
381  {
382  if constexpr (std::is_same_v<T,
383  std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<innermost_pointer_type<T>>>>) {
384  // Field is a vector, so resize vector and read in directly
385  bool success = stream.read(m_field);
386  if (success) {
387  m_info.m_count = m_field.size();
388  m_info.m_fieldData = m_field.data();
389  }
390  return success;
391  }
392  else {
393  // Field is not a vector, so read in using data pointer
394  return stream.read(m_info.m_fieldData, m_info.m_count);
395  }
396  }
397 
398  // SFINAE solution, C++17 one is cleaner
399  //template<typename U = T>
400  //inline std::enable_if_t<std::is_same<U, std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<innermost_pointer_type<U>>>>::value, bool> read(const FileStream& stream)
401  //{
402  // return stream.read(m_field);
403  //}
404  //template<typename U = T>
405  //inline std::enable_if_t<!std::is_same<U, std::vector<std::remove_pointer_t<innermost_pointer_type<U>>>>::value, bool> read(const FileStream& stream)
406  //{
407  // return stream.read(m_info.m_fieldData, m_info.m_count);
408  //}
409 
411 
412  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
415 
416  ProtocolField<T>& operator=(const ProtocolField<T>& field) {
417  m_field = field.m_field;
418  m_info = field.m_info;
419  return *this;
420  }
421 
423 
424 
426  ProtocolFieldInfo<T> m_info;
427 
429  //T& m_field;
430  reference_type<T> m_field;
431 };
432

435 } // end namespacing
